p: This plant belongs to the family of Lamiaceae and is commonly known as red sage [ 274]. Its bioactive components are extracted from the root, including lipophilic diterpenoids, flavonoids, triterpenoids and hydrophilic phenolic compounds [ 163, 274, 275]. It is also used for the treatment of various diseases, such as removing blood stasis, improving blood circulation, atherosclerosis, thrombosis, angina pectoris, other cardiovascular diseases and antiviral activity of HIV-1 and Enterovirus by inhibiting RdRp enzyme activity [ 161, 162, 163, 164].
